title: Shringar: hair styles of India
creator_contributor_role: Films Division, Government of India, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/India - Social life and customs
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Hairstyles
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Women - India
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Women - India
description: Indian women's hair styles; their origin in tradition; how the hair is dressed and how the styles may be adapted to wear with Western dress. A stylist makes sketches for hair styles based on those seen in temple carvings and the Ajunta cave frescoes; how the hair is oiled and the styles built up; the use of garlands, particularly jasmine, and jkewellery; dressing a Western woman's hair in adaptations of Indian styles.
